meanings.definition: A movement in art and literature that emphasized the future, technology, and speed.
meanings.sent1: The futurism of the painting captured a world filled with flying cars and robots.
meanings.sent2: Many artists in the early 20th century were inspired by futurism and its focus on progress.
meanings.sent3: The art exhibit showcasing futurism made visitors feel like they were stepping into tomorrow.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination soared as she delved into the world of futurism, envisioning a universe of endless possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The essence of futurism in the artwork left a lasting impression on all who viewed it.

meanings.definition: The study or prediction of future developments based on current trends.
meanings.sent1: Futurism in technology involves analyzing data to foresee upcoming advancements.
meanings.sent2: Experts in futurism use statistical models to anticipate changes in society.
meanings.sent3: The futurism report predicted a rise in virtual reality vacations by 2030.
meanings.sent4: His knack for futurism allowed him to foresee the rise of electric vehicles before many others.
meanings.sent5: The company's success was attributed to their accurate futurism in predicting market trends.

meanings.definition: A belief or attitude that the future will be better than the present.
meanings.sent1: Her futurism kept her optimistic during challenging times, believing in brighter days ahead.
meanings.sent2: The futurism of the children was evident in their excitement for what tomorrow might bring.
meanings.sent3: Even on rainy days, his futurism shone through, convinced that the sun would eventually appear.
meanings.sent4: In the face of adversity, her unwavering futurism inspired those around her to keep moving forward.
meanings.sent5: The community's collective futurism fueled their efforts to create a better world for generations to come.
